strings.Value: "I had to find you."
"I want answers, Tristian."
"I should break your neck, traitor!"
"Give me what you took from Vordakai."
"All who have erred deserve a second chance — isn't that what Sarenrae teaches us? Let's talk, you and I."
"Surrender the Oculus of Abaddon! Now!"
"Who is your true mistress?"
"Fine, keep the Oculus. Let's just talk!"
"Enough idle talk, Tristian!"
"It brought me to you."
"Why are you trying to run away? The Oculus is broken, Vordakai defeated. Stop fleeing and let's talk!"
"Where are you fleeing to? To whom? Who sent you to me?"
"All who have erred deserve a second chance — isn't that what Sarenrae teaches us? Let's talk, you and I."
"I'm tired of your pathetic words. Prepare to die."
"In Vordakai's tomb I saw... something odd. What were those wings that appeared behind your back, Tristian?"
"Tell me, are you satisfied? Satisfied with the suffering to countless innocents by opening those portals? Answer!"
"Thank the gods you're alive! I was so afraid for you!"
{n}Tristian raises his head as you approach. His face is a mask of grief and desperation.{/n} "Why did you come here, {name}?"
{n}The cleric averts his eyes.{/n} "This is no answer to my question. Why? To kill me? To try and make things right? It's too late, {name} — there's nothing you can change. Just as I couldn't."

{n}Tristian's face turns grey.{/n} "No." {n}He gulps and shakes his head.{/n} "The Oculus of {g|Abaddon}Abaddon{/g} is an evil artifact, capable of revealing what is hidden. I would destroy it once and for all. But I... I can't do it. My mistress demands it."

"Forgive me, {name}. The force that has enslaved me will do the same to you. I've already put you in terrible danger, and I won't let you suffer any longer. Save yourself and those you hold dear — forget me, forget the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g}. Farewell."

{n}A slight smile lightens Tristian's face.{/n} "Curious, as always. Was it that that brought you to the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g} in the first place? And to the {g|Temple of the Elk}Temple of the Elk{/g}, where we first met?" {n}His smile fades.{/n} "If so, your curiosity leads you to your death."

{n}Tristian recoils, as if struck.{/n} "You are right. I am a traitor. I don't expect forgiveness or understanding from you, but trust me — if I had a chance to change what happened, I would. But I can't. I can't stop now, and I can't look into your eyes."

"No, I beg you, {name}… hold your weapons still. I have one thing I must finish first. Please... stop following me. The powers you seek to confront are too great — you can't hope to defeat them. Save yourself and take those you hold dear and flee the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g}."

{n}Tristian shakes his head.{/n} "No. You don't need to know that, {name}. Neither you nor any mortal can confront the one that controls me. Your only chance to survive is if flee now, and leave the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g} behind. This is all I can do for you now."

"You've always put your trust in me, {name}. And I repaid you with betrayal. I beg your forgiveness, though my actions are unforgivable. Return home. Or better, do not return... flee the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g}. Don't let the power that enslaved me destroy you and those you hold dear."

{n}Tristian shakes his head — a gesture of either denial or regret.{/n} "Forgive me. I've caused you great trouble, so let me give you the only thing I can still give — my advice. Forget the Oculus. Stop chasing me. Better, flee the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g}. Save yourself and those you still can."

{n}Deathly pale, Tristian opens his mouth to answer, but pauses, then gives a heavy sigh.{/n} "There is no answer for what I did, {name}. I shall carry this weight until the end of my life. Perhaps..." {n}Tristian raises his head in alert.{/n} "Perhaps there is still a chance to change one last thing..." {n}Tristian's face collapses and becomes downcast.{/n} "No. I'm only lying to myself."
"Forgive me, {name}... Please forgive me."
{n}Tristian drops his head.{/n} "An apostate and a weakling. Betrayer of everything that is pure. I'm nothing… no. I'm, less than nothing, {name}."
{n}Tristian freezes. A shadow of a smile appears on his face.{/n} "I... I'm so happy to hear your voice again... even if it's for the last time."
"Look how our quiet priest is talking. Like it's not us who came to ask for an answer for his treason, but he is."
"Who do I see in front of me? A friend who made a mistake or an enemy, slipping on a mask of a friend?"
"Please, Tristian, tell us the truth! I don't want to believe that you deceived us from the very beginning, just waiting for a moment to strike us in the back!"

"Hey, boy-priest, how about a bit of public penance? You owe us at least an hour's show, full of tears and stories about how you didn't want to do it, weren't going to, and how you're really not guilty at all!"
"I've seen do-gooders doing bad things often enough. It shouldn't surprise me, but still I look at you and I don't understand. Why, Tristian? Why did you betray us? Why are you running from us?"
